pullRequest.title: DPC-1199: Cancel button on Enable/Edit API page not working
pullRequest.bodyText:
Why
If an internal user triggers an error when trying to register an organization in the API and then tried to click the Cancel, it would throw an error.

What Changed
Changed :back to a more hard coded url path.
Choices Made
After confirming this happened to some Cancel links, and for consistency, all :backs were changed to url paths.
Tickets closed:
DPC-1199
Future Work
N/A
Checklist

 All tests are passing via make ci-app (app change) and make ci-web (website change)
[N/A] Swagger documentation has been updated
[N/A] FHIR documentation has been updated
[N/A] Any required dpc-ops changes have a PR submitted and mentioned in this ticket
[N/A] Any manual migration steps are documented, scripts written (where applicable), and tested
[N/A] Before merging, any required dpc-ops changes have been approved and merged into master of the dpc-ops repo

commit.message: Changed cancel links to hard url paths for edit user and registered org forms
Changed 'Cancel' url links for organization forms

nodes.bodyText:
I should have looked at your PR first before creating my own >_<
I ended up finding this one while testing the web app. I changed it to internal_user_path(@user) so that the Cancel button would put you back to the user page from where the edit was originally called. Let me know if that isnt correct behavior and I can remove that myself.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -107,7 +107,7 @@
 
       <div class="ds-l-col--9 field-group__fields ds-u-border--0">
         <%= f.submit "Update user", class: "ds-c-button ds-c-button--primary", data: { test: "user-form-submit" } %>
-        <%= link_to "Cancel", :back, class: "ds-c-button ds-c-button--transparent" %>
+        <%= link_to "Cancel", internal_organizations_path, class: "ds-c-button ds-c-button--transparent" %>
